rounds.claim: Undocumented immigrants pay $12–25 billion in taxes yearly while being ineligible for most benefits — they are a net fiscal contributor.

rebuttal.text: When you include their U.S.-born children and state/local costs (education, healthcare, welfare), the net fiscal drain is $100–150 billion annually (NAS 2017, CIS 2023).

counterRebuttal.text: Even excluding citizen children, low-skill immigrant-headed households still consume more in services than they pay in taxes over their lifetime.

rounds.claim: Over 100,000 Americans have died from fentanyl since 2021 — the vast majority smuggled through the southern border.

rebuttal.text: 90–97% of fentanyl is seized at legal ports of entry, smuggled by U.S. citizens — not by asylum-seekers crossing between ports.

rounds.claim: Bodily autonomy is absolute — no one can be forced to use their body to sustain another life, even if that life is a fetus.

rebuttal.text: The fetus is a distinct human organism with its own DNA and heartbeat by 6 weeks — abortion intentionally ends an innocent human life.

counterRebuttal.text: Personhood is not granted at conception in law or biology — viability (~24 weeks) or birth is the historical and legal line in most societies.

rounds.claim: Modern ultrasound and fetal surgery show pain capacity by 20 weeks — late-term abortions are especially brutal.

rebuttal.text: Late-term abortions are <1% of cases and almost always for severe fetal anomalies or maternal health — bans force women to carry non-viable pregnancies.

rounds.claim: 97% scientific consensus: human CO₂ emissions are the primary driver of recent global warming.

rebuttal.text: The 97% figure is heavily disputed and based on abstract counting — many scientists disagree on magnitude and danger.

rounds.claim: Every major climate model since 1990 has over-predicted warming — reality is running below predictions.

rebuttal.text: When corrected for natural variability (El Niño, volcanoes), observed warming tracks the middle of model projections.

counterRebuttal.text: Even with adjustments, the models still run hot — and net-zero policies will cost trillions while delivering negligible temperature reduction.

rounds.claim: Gender-affirming care for minors is life-saving — every major medical body (AMA, AAP, APA) endorses it.

rebuttal.text: Sweden, Finland, Norway, and the UK have all restricted youth gender medicine after systematic reviews found low-quality evidence and high regret rates.

counterRebuttal.text: Those countries still allow care for severe cases — they tightened protocols, not banned it. Desistance rates pre-2015 were inflated by outdated diagnostic criteria.

rounds.claim: Allowing biological males in women’s sports and prisons erases sex-based rights and safety protections.

rebuttal.text: Trans women on hormone therapy for 12+ months lose most strength advantages — inclusion with conditions is fair.

rounds.claim: Black Americans are 2.5–3× more likely to be killed by police than white Americans — systemic bias exists.

rebuttal.text: When adjusted for crime rates and encounter frequency, racial disparities in police killings largely disappear (Harvard 2019, Roland Fryer).

counterRebuttal.text: Fryer’s study only looked at Houston; national studies still show disparity after controlling for crime (Ross 2015, Edwards 2019).

rounds.claim: Cities that defunded police in 2020 saw historic murder spikes — 30–50% increases in many cities.

rebuttal.text: Correlation ≠ causation — the pandemic, economic collapse, and gun proliferation drove the 2020–2021 spike nationwide, including in cities that increased police budgets.

rounds.claim: Historical discrimination created lasting disparities — active correction (DEI, affirmative action) is necessary for true equality.

rebuttal.text: DEI often means explicit racial preferences that discriminate against whites and Asians — the Supreme Court ruled race-based admissions unconstitutional in 2023.

counterRebuttal.text: The ruling banned race as the decisive factor but explicitly allowed consideration of lived experience with racism in essays.

rounds.claim: Mandatory DEI training has been shown to increase bias and resentment, not reduce it (Harvard Business Review meta-analysis).

rebuttal.text: Poorly designed one-hour trainings fail — long-term, well-implemented programs with accountability do reduce bias.
